website_summaries.verdict: The Fitbit One is a feature-rich pedometer, but the wristband-style Jawbone Up and Fitbit’s own Flex are more convenient and much better deals.
pros: The Fitbit One offers an intuitive way to track and analyze your sleep, the steps you take, stairs climbed, and calories burned
Small and light, the One is very portable
Its OLED screen, which has a clock, is easy to read
It sends data to phones over Bluetooth
cons: The Fitbit One’s clip often comes loose
The One's Bluetooth syncing function only works with a few compatible handsets thus far

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit is no longer making the Fitbit One.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion the Fitbit One is the best fitness tracker made!!! I am so bummed that They are not making it anymore!!!! It is sad that Amazon is capitalizing on this fact and have more than doubled the price of the original FItbit One. It is only so expensive now, because it isn't being produced anymore, which means they will no longer support it either. Fitbit is phasing it out.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaBB

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite Fitbits so sad they don’t make these anymore.
customer_reviews.author: 80s

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty good.. just takes a bit for it to catch up on the steps sometimes.. I paid like $98 for it a few years ago and see that now it’s close to $300?! What the heck?
customer_reviews.author: 2bear

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product. My first Fitbit One lasted over 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. My first Fitbit One lasted over 3 years before finally breaking down (the battery didn't take a charge very well, and secondly, the button somehow broke off this week). This is my 2nd Fitbit One which now replaces my first Fitbit One from 2014. I noticed that this specific model is becoming increasingly hard to find as it appears that Fitbit is trying to phase this model out. In my opinion, this is the best one they ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: Very simple, compact, and helpful
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of this device. Counts all my steps accurately and is very slim and compact, the phone-based app has lots of great information. Only caution is because it's so tiny, if you're not careful with it, it can get lost. If you keep it in the silicone-rubber case it comes with, and keep it securely clipped to your clothing, no worries. If you place it loosely in a pocket, it can get lost. If you wear a wristwatch and don't want to replace it with a fitness watch or wrist-model Fitbit, this is a great solution.
customer_reviews.author: Brian GA

customer_reviews.title: It's great if you want something small and not obvious
customer_reviews.text: It's great if you want something small and not obvious. The downside: I've lost two of these because they fell off where I had them hooked (my bra once, the inside of my pocket the second). It also doesn't have all of the features of newer (and more expensive models). It suits its purpose but wary of losing it. I have a Fitbit Blaze now which I like better because of all of its features and its much more difficult to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Jeannine Wallace

customer_reviews.title: A Pedometer that is actually accurate (unlike the wrist-style ones).
customer_reviews.text: I've lost four of them but I keep buying new ones. A pedometer should be near your waist unlike this stupid wrist-style pedometers which often confuse moving your hands (driving, typing, talking like an Italian person) with walking. But wearing this Fitbit One on my waist I know if Im glued to my chair it's not going to think I'm walking. Very accurate. Charges fast, battery lasts about a week. Plus its discreet and can be used to track exercising and sleep. Don't be fooled by the wrist-style pedometers!! All for vanity and not accurate! If you truly care about tracking your movement stick with the classic.
customer_reviews.author: Logan D.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Flex
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for well over a year now. I still use it. I clip it into my underwear band so it's discreet and I don't feel it. The app is great. I love using it to track runs rather than have a separate running app. I used to use a separate app and it integrated well, but there is really no need! I did have a Fitbit Flex as well that I used for a few months in between but I really missed the display. I should mention that I have machine washed and dried this accidentally twice now and the thing still works like it is new. That is pretty impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren U

customer_reviews.title: Both accessories already broken. Now it down not work. What a waste of $100
customer_reviews.text: The wristband didn't last a month. I wore it ever night and it no longer sticks. And the clip, the plastic end part broke off so it doesn't stay secure to what I clip it on now. I have only had it a couple months and it is already not working. It won't turn on. I have tried 2 different chargers.
customer_reviews.author: erica m.

customer_reviews.title: Great little activity tracker...
customer_reviews.text: Love this little tracker...especially the way it connects to my exercise-tracking apps on my iPhone. Wonderful that it is rechargeable by just using the adapter and plugging it in...no batteries to try to change or buy. Downside is, they have apparently stopped offering/selling the Fitbit One. At least I've not been able to find them anywhere recently when I was looking for one.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: The one star is not because I hate the device it's because it stopped working in less ...
customer_reviews.text: The one star is not because I hate the device it's because it stopped working in less than a week of owning it. I thought maybe the battery died and so I charged it all night but that was not the problem. It's dead! So sad cuz I loved using it the 3 days I had it...lol There goes $100 :-(
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Corsi

customer_reviews.title: Fitness tracking shouldn't be expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Fitbit One user for a year and have become an enthusiastic walker, typically 12,000 steps per day. This model is the most economical of exercise tracking devices out there. For those who prefer a wristband type device (at greater cost) an inexpensive wrist band FB1 holder is available. I don't use the sleep tracker. Combined with the free app you can monitor your progress and receive weekly emailed reports. Friendly competition with other users is also enabled via the app. Highly recommend the Fitbit One for anyone interested in personal fitness.
customer_reviews.author: BobAck

customer_reviews.title: Like new item, easy & fast transaction
customer_reviews.text: I wish fitbit still made this tracker that can be worn discreetly. I am so happy I found on Amazon & I am enjoying my tracker after loosing my original one. This is like new & is working great after several weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: kcrrn58

customer_reviews.title: Love my FitBit One!
customer_reviews.text: Love my FitBit One! I love FitBit offers one that doesn't have to be worn on the wrist! As a professional, one that I can clip to me discreetly is important. This is my 2nd FitBit One, after having my first one for a couple years and then it accidentally getting flushed down the toilet (RIP to my first FitBit). I believe the steps on the FitBit One are even more accurate than some of the other FitBit devices. I love that it syncs to my phone so I don't have to look at it if it is hidden discreetly (sometimes I wear in the middle of my bra or on my panty line). Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Mother of three girls...

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for their exchange policy. Fitbit will not ...
customer_reviews.text: Watch out for their exchange policy. Fitbit will not exchange your fitbit without putting your device without putting you through extensive effort. They insist on testing the device battery over a period of time which requires you to interact with them at least twice. They refuse to simply let you exchange your problem fitbit for another one. Your will do a lot of work and experience much hassel for a $100 device.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL SPRAGUE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I wear this Fitbit One every day, all day. Seeing the amount of steps I take is very rewarding, and motivates me to be more active. I have only used the sleep function twice, and have not used the food diary, so I can't judge their accuracy and usefulness. However, I do record my water intake and exercise. My only complaint is that there are too few choices for exercise. Adding common everyday chores such as vacuuming and mowing would be helpful. Since I manually sync with the Fitbit application a few times a day, instead of using the all day sync option, a short battery life is not an issue. One battery charge lasts me about a week.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Overprice and much better options now
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot better options as of me writing this review. It used to be a great product but mine broke after a year. In doing research for another sleep tracker there are more options for a much better price. They have discontinued this product so don't even bother looking at this as an option.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Turns Off Randomly
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product but it isn't a reliable source of data-my device turns off throughout the day. My first Fitbit I bought in December was not counting accurately, comparing with coworkers at the end of the day and I would have very different numbers. I contacted the company and they sent me a new device, which shuts off during the day. I love the idea of a Fitbit...but I'm having the worst luck. Too bad I missed the return period on this product!
customer_reviews.author: beckeyz

customer_reviews.title: really like my Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like my Fitbit! The easy-to-read display lets me see in an instant how many steps I've taken, how many miles that equals, how many calories I've burned, the time and the date. I can also use my computer, tablet, or phone to view those stats (and more) if my Fitbit is tucked away in some unobtrusive spot. My one suggestion would be that, if you have an awkward or uneven gait, you wear it in the vicinity of your waist or on your arm instead of on your chest. I finally realized that is why it didn't seem to be counting all my steps. I moved it to the pocket of my jeans and now it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Donne

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I got this I've become much more active and found myself going for runs several times weekly. I like that I don't have to wear it on my wrist all the time. The battery is also rechargeable and lasts for a week, which is amazing. The only negative thing is the sleep tracking band that comes with it. It wore out after only a couple weeks of use and now falls off multiple times a night. I will be buying one made of rubber and similar to a watch for sleep tracking since the app still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: ... that tracks steps and stairs - this is a good solution. I prefer something that doesn't go on ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a simple fitness device that tracks steps and stairs - this is a good solution. I prefer something that doesn't go on my wrist, so this fits the bill. The clip that comes with this seems to hold really well - I always had problems with first generation FitBits getting knocked off my pocket - I can't see that being and issue with this one. I don't use the sleep band - so can't comment on that. There seems to be some question about what's included - this here is the full retail package: Fitbit One, holder clip, charging cable, sleep wrist band.
customer_reviews.author: Mellow Sparky

customer_reviews.title: The Fitbit One is the perfect fitness device for beginners to fitness apps and trackers
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit One is the perfect fitness device for beginners to fitness apps and trackers. It is simple, straightforward, and easy to use. Mine synced with my tablet first try and I have never had any issues with the technology. It's a little clunky if you want to use the sleep tracking mode, but otherwise, I love it. I feel it's accurate in its measurements as well. Of course, the best part of Fitbit brand is the Fitbit app and having all your statistics monitored automatically, and having other friends with fitbits to participate in challenges and earn badges. It's a fun way to stay in shape, and the Fitbit one makes it affordable.
customer_reviews.author: liserbiser

customer_reviews.title: Small, discreet, accurate. Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I love this little device. You can carry it anywhere and it accurately measures steps while coordinating well with the iphone. My only issue is that twice now I forgot I had clipped it to my bra and I put the bra with the attached fitbit in the wash...luckily I was able to fish it out before it got wet...otherwise it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Haiponers

customer_reviews.title: Gets you up and moving!
customer_reviews.text: The Fibit One is great. It is good for tracking all of your exercise. The smart phone app lets you sync with your device and see and keep a record of everything. I wear mine everyday, everywhere, basically all the time. It's actually a gentle reminder to take that extra step, use the stairs in place of the elevator, park farther from the store you are going into. You can also tract your sleep at night. This thing does everything except cook breakfast. But you can record all those calories from breakfast on your food plan. Just stick it in your pocket and go. It holds a charge for about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for those of us that don't like wrist trackers!
customer_reviews.text: This is great, since I don't have to wear it around my wrist. Over the usage of about a month in my pocket(s), the plastic piece on the end of the clip has broken off, and a I have a strange metal fork thingy to navigate over my pocket. It's not that big of a deal as you can get a new one here:  I would say, however, that unless you are having weekly challenges with people (coworkers, family) then it is very easy to forget to put it in your pocket for the day, and then you will forget about it. Being proactive is harder without the daily challenges!
customer_reviews.author: John Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping fit
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a good purchase for anyone who wants to make staying fit or losing weight a bit more fun. I can't say it is super accurate, but I bet for what it is it is pretty close. I like the app you download that counts your calories and makes a sport out of losing weight or staying fit. Also, this going inside your pocket is better than an armband.
customer_reviews.author: RiverRat

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Died after very little use. Updates froze and the bluetooth hardware dies. I only used it a handful of times. Support offered me a 25% discount on a new item. Spend more money on Fitbit? Never.
customer_reviews.author: I King

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit One: The healthiest addiction I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this gadget. Three friends have already bought themselves one since seeing how much fun I am having with this. It's easy to use, the iPhone app and website are great, and it is inherently motivating. I was already an active person, but I think my activity level has increased by at least 25% just being able to see my progress and set (and measure) goals for myself. It syncs flawlessly with MyFitnessPal, which I've been using for years. I'm also told it syncs with RunKeeper. Note: you do NOT need to purchase the sleep wristband and belt clip separately. They come with the Fitbit One.
customer_reviews.author: Anne T

customer_reviews.title: Almost like a pet.
customer_reviews.text: Small, discreet; sticks nicely in pocket, waistband, collar, or bra, and fits into wrist band without irritating rubbing. Tells me the time, and greets me with silly phrases if I set it down for a few minutes. Almost like a cat, but quieter. Unlike a cat, it wants me to move around, take it for a walk. An almost perfect pet, wants to go for walks, and talks to me if I sit still. Sleeps when I sleep, gets lots of fireworks when I do something special. I wish it had more colors than black. Everything is black, and gets lost in pockets or the bottom of a bag. Fuchsia and fire-engine yellow-green would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Turgidson

customer_reviews.title: When looking to buy a new Fitbit 1 for a ...
customer_reviews.text: When looking to buy a new Fitbit 1 for a friend I find that they are now 3X the price I paid for mine! What a ripoff! It is not worth it. I will not buy any more Fitbit products until this changes. When does an old model become 3X the of the original? When you ATTEMPTING to forcing them to buy your new product.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit please make User-Entered BMR RMR REE Metabolism for accurate calorie counting
customer_reviews.text: Love it because these have lasted our family, friends, and research study participants for much much longer than the Striiv, Misfit, Jawbone products. Further, the iPhone 5s proves to miscount when traveling up the mountains (does fine going down), so the Fitbit One continues to Win the Day with me. Please help me (and many others) convince Fitbit to *continue to be the industry leader in activity tracking*: petition them to create a User-Entry for Metabolism (RMR, BMR, REE) so that the calories counting can be somewhat relevant! The Mifflin-St Jeor, the Harris-Benedict, etc... are all population averages! Who cares about the AVG? ;-) We want personalized tracking!!
customer_reviews.author: David Jackemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Step count works but the app has bugs and is very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Although other users have reported their friend's step counts have stopped working again when updates have been applied, mine has been working since Aug 2017. So hopefully it keeps working. ---Jun 25, 2017--- The step counts on my first 5 friends in my list update regularly. The next 5 friends all say 0 steps and are shown as "Inactive", but when we look at their Fitbit app it shows their steps. But if I do a challenge with 1 of the Inactive friends, their step counts are shown in the challenge summary and who won but they still show 0 steps in my friends list and Inactive. Many users have had this problem for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: WeisD

customer_reviews.title: Much to like: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Much to like: ease of use, multi-functions, easy charge and sync, compactness. I'd been using my iPhone app but if I was without pockets my steps weren't recorded. This little number solves that but has its own problem. Some days when carrying both my iPhone and Fitbit the same length of time, I end the day with 4,000 extra Fitbit steps. Every bump in the road when driving, and who knows what else, counts on Fitbit. A short jog counts as stair climbing. To get an accurate picture of hiking steps taken, I have to note the number when I begin and end. So this serves some purpose but yet not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria L.

customer_reviews.title: Product has been discontinued and does not work....nor does the MFR warrant the item
customer_reviews.text: It did not work. I learned that Fitbit had a system update that made a lot of the One's crash, rendering them useless. I tried a hard reset many times and finally contacted Customer Service at FitBit. They said there was nothing they could do. So I returned it. Based on Forum's on the internet, this is an extensive issue for people with One's.
customer_reviews.author: sarakb

customer_reviews.title: Counts steps and holds a good charge for several days before needing plugged back in.
customer_reviews.text: I like this for the price. I don't like they way it keeps track of sleep but it is ok for steps and holds a good charge. To use sleep function you have to push the button to let it know you are going to sleep and when you wake up. That isn't something I want to bother with so I don't use that part.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Love not wearing it on my wrist
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product....until it quit working only six months after I got it. I loved everything about it, but one day it just died. It didn't need charging, even though I tried but it didn't work. Nothing worked, it just died. I can see if I had it for several years, but this product should have lasted much longer than six months. I am very disappointed... UPDATE: I changed my rating and found a fix to my problem. I am still using my device and have had it almost a year now. I really love it!
customer_reviews.author: Representing

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Hold a Charge!
customer_reviews.text: This is a defective product. It only responds when plugged in. The FitBit app says it is fully charged. Then when you take it off, nothing. I spoke with FitBit customer service. They said the issues I am having are often associated with a device that was previously connected to a different email address, and I have only had it associated with one. Perhaps someone had this before me? If that's the case, it should have been fully disclosed. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Didn't synch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my original FitBit One which is getting old and the plastic clip part is deteriorating after daily use over several years. When I received it and tried synching it to the FitBit app it would not work. I called FitBit whose rep was quite helpful but came to the conclusion that this was a disfunctional unit. It did count steps, stairs, etc but would not communicate with the computer. FitBit rep said they would replace it even though I not purchased it directly from them so I sent it in and am still waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystalsea

customer_reviews.title: Great Item and Support
customer_reviews.text: Great item, keeps up with all steps and portable to my companies Virgin Healthmiles program. Only thing I didn't find particularly useful was the sleep mode, so I just stopped using it. Bought it in June, and it started acting up with not responding unless I did a long hold then the device reset and lost all my data. My opinion on the One was starting to suffer so I decided to email their support line after trying the resets recommended on their site. In my email I described the problem and what I tried and with no issues at all they are processing my replacement. The One is a versatile gadget, and their support team is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Cory B

customer_reviews.title: The Fitbit One is a great product. I love how it tracks my calories ...
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit One is a great product. I love how it tracks my calories burned, steps taken, total miles AND how many floors I climb. Being able to also track my sleep patterns is great, as it helps me figure out why some days I may be tired during the day. The website also is motivating when you add other fitbit users so you can challenge each other, and see all your stats whether on the phone or via the website. Great product I look forward to getting my 10,000 steps a day and it has really helped motivate me in my weight loss journey. Between changing my eating habits and using my fitbit, I have lost 20 pounds!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ADiggs

customer_reviews.title: A lot to pay for so little milage.
customer_reviews.text: It stopped charging after one year--and no help from FitBit. A lot to pay for so little milage. Especially now that the price doubled.
customer_reviews.author: AE

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I found this fitbit to be very inaccurate compared to my charge hr so I returned it. Also, when they were in close proximity to each other, they synced, so what inaccurate steps recorded on the fitbit one got transferred over to the charge hr (maybe because I had the fitbit one as the primary fitbit, since you can have two different fitbits in one account active). The only way I could compare the two, was to have only one powered up and charged and used one at a time. The fitbit one was way to exaggerated of how many steps I was taking a day. Felt great to see more steps but I knew the truth.
customer_reviews.author: mhof2000

customer_reviews.title: GREAT little motivation!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I waited so long to get one of these! Love it in every way. Don't need to track what you don't care about but the things you do care about are easily and precisely tracked all day, all night long! Not hard to set up or understand in any way and that was what was keeping me from buying one. Now I am hooked and can hardly wait to look at my dashboard from the day before. I don't have a tablet or a smart phone but it is also quite easy to watch on my PC. Love this little thing and you can wear it how you please.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Burch

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate for anything but walking on flat ground or climbing stairs. Not good for hiking where the ground is varied.
customer_reviews.text: Use it; but always is inaccurate for what we do. If all you do is hike and climb stairs; this probably would work fine. If you use it to hike cliffs and steep inclines it gives far too little calories burned. Figures that you aren't going fast, so you're not burning calories even if you are climbing cliffs. It has said we went 150 stories sometimes because of the mountains we climb; yet only say we burned 1500 calories when we were sweating up a storm. Not real smart unless you're just walking on flat ground or climbing stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: The Fitbit One's time has passed
customer_reviews.text: This tracker was my favorite for years and I have been through many of them due to loss or abuse. The One is no longer produced and the inflated price you pay for the product is probably for something that has been sitting around for quite a while. I purchased a One last week for a crazy high price because I like the trackers so much. The unit worked flawlessly for four days and it all ended. The unit would not synch, charge or update as prompted. Unfortunately, I had to send it back and will search for something more current. Save yourself some time, money, and aggrevation.
customer_reviews.author: josie collier

customer_reviews.title: Great tracker, company stands behind their product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, more accurate than the wrist device because count steps when you are moving your arms. I wish that they would put a location sound on it. I've lost three of them in the past 3 years. Fitbit did send me a replacement One the first time I lost mine. That was great, I will hold off on another until they have a way to track it. Yes, I've used different Bluetooth trackers but they can still be hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: It worked passably for a while, then after 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked passably for a while, then after 3.5 years it just died. I only used it as a sleep tracker and silent alarm so it was hardly put to rough use. While it did work it occasionally had serious syncing issues that required rebooting and sync spamming.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Robert Ganz

customer_reviews.title: they way the clip is made leads to it easily popping off the belt
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a fan of this. The belt clip does not adequately stay on the belt; they way the clip is made leads to it easily popping off the belt. Using the unit in the enclosed wristband to measure sleep has resulted in it being accidentally pressed (pressure against the mattress) and turning off sleep mode. I would think they could have easily fixed that by requiring a double button press instead of just one press. I carry it in my pocket (as opposed to on the belt), and the count does appear to be relatively accurate, which is why I gave it three instead of one or two stars. I am just not a fan of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Baron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because my doctor suggested that I walk 8,000 - 10,000 steps per day. This is the same little piece that fits inside the pricier wristband models and it's much more convenient for me. I like that, during the day, the fitbit is in a clip that attached to my clothing. And, at night, it fits right into a soft wrist wrap to measure my sleep. As for those 8,000 - 10,000 steps ... I'm working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: I never knew I walked so much (or so little).
customer_reviews.text: This device is really cute. Like the Fitbit Aria scale this device only does one thing but it does it well. The sleep tracking aspect, honestly is a joke. It works, if you don't mind having a velcro piece strapped to your wrist when you sleep, but the data it records is minimal (restful vs restlessness) and can't really be compared to anything about your day to day living/activity. I do like this device. Sleep tracking aside, it really only tracks your steps and stairs climbed, which in my estimation is probably around 95% accurate. Also, like the Fitbit Aria it pairs nicely with myfitnesspal.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: privacy issues
customer_reviews.text: After about a week's use I thought I had lost the One but then found it the next day on the passenger's seat. After this close call, I am carrying it inside a pocket. It seems to give a pretty accurate step count (I will update the accuracy after further testing). What I don't like is the company's information collection, which I consider invasive. I found I could not even set the time on the device without giving personal information. Currently I am resigned to accept a flip-over time of 1:08 PM instead of submitting to their prying. My measuring shows dimensions of: Length 48.0 mm, Width 19.2 mm, Thickness 8.8 mm, Weight 8 grams.
customer_reviews.author: limestone_lenny

customer_reviews.title: Great motivator.
customer_reviews.text: Great fitness tracker. I put it on every day and it motivates me to walk. I never realized how many times I do stairs each day until I got this. I haven't bothered to keep track of my sleep time. I like that I can charge it with USB. It charges very fast and keeps a charge for several weeks and lets me know when it needs to be recharged. The silicone clip case is nice, and it's easy to take off when it needs to be recharged.
customer_reviews.author: ARuhland

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit One
customer_reviews.text: After setting up the fitbit, it works great. Really keeps you legal in all that you do. Gave one to a friend as a birthday gift, and she also loves it. Comfortable to wear. Loaded to my phone and can get results quickly. Sorry to say I didn't know what a dongle was, had to look that up online!!! Ha. I found it to keep a charge for a long time. Have had no issues so far. Took it on vacation with me. The house we rented at the beach had three floors. I don't know how the fitbit knows how many times I climbed those floors, but it knows! And it gave me credit for it. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: chili mama

customer_reviews.title: I love Fitbit One
customer_reviews.text: I feel that this is more accurate than the watch. It is too bad they stopped making them and the retailers who still have them in stock are making a pretty penny on them.
customer_reviews.author: boofo

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: A really great device. I loved using it. I have now lost the second one, so I am no longer using one. My guess is that the clip does not hold tight enough or maybe I do not pay attention as I should. Whatever the reason, I have owned two and lost each one within three months of their purchase. It is small device and the price is way too high for me to lose one every few months as I have with the first two. Wish I could continue to use the device, but I simply cannot afford to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fitness Tracker
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Fitbit product after my original Fitibit Ultra failed after nearly 2 1/2 years of daily use. The Fitibit One has been a useful tool in activity tracking and I purchased one for my wife and myself and we daily challenge each other to see who is the most active. The wireless/bluetooth connectivity is awesome connecting to your computer or phone/tablet. We have been averaging 7-10 days battery life and charging is quick and simple with the included wireless charging dongle. No issues with another great Fitibit Product!!
customer_reviews.author: island_boy_0069

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit One doesn't hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit One seems like a great fitness tracker as it counts steps, calories burned, floors climbed and tracks sleep. The downside is that it doesn't hold a charge. When brand new, it held a charge for 10 days, five months later, a full charge lasts for a day (because it won't hold a charge, it needs to be restarted daily so that it can sync with a phone.)
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Ent

customer_reviews.title: Love Fitbit One!
customer_reviews.text: The fitbit is fantastic! I didn't want one that is a bracelet around the wrist. I have been wearing it everyday for a little over 2 years. It's motivating and I walk way more steps. I really like the work week hustle challenge. When I'm not paying attention I might walk 5,000 steps a day and when I'm really working at it and using my fitbit as a great motivation and tool I'm averaging 10,000-15,000 steps a day. I haven't had any issues with the fitbit one in 2+ years I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Oldham

customer_reviews.title: Not just steps
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to remind me to take my medicine. I have a crazy schedule and this medicine must be time adjusted depending on my work schedule. This works great for me. I can adjust the time day to day. I don't care how many steps I walk in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ok for a while
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tracker for about 11 months and am mostly happy with it, but there are some flaws that have me looking for a different tracker. First, the tracker lost the ability to teansfer info to pc or phone. I had to reset my device and lost all the info that was saved on the device. Second, the rubber on the case has started to fall off and the metal underneath pokes me sometimes. It has also ripped a few of my shirts, so that's been a disappointment. When it works its great, but don't expect it to last a year.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gillette

customer_reviews.title: Easily lost
customer_reviews.text: I had this for a week....before I lost it. It was clipped to my pants pocket and was even rigged with a lobster clasp, but somehow I still managed to lose it. I was not even doing anything remotely strenuous, just out for groceries. If you look at the reviews here, it looks like a lot of people lost theirs too. Seemed accurate enough at counting steps and stairs. Disappointed that it does not count calories when lifting weights, my fault for not researching it.
customer_reviews.author: Pastells

customer_reviews.title: Present to wife. She was initially not that "hot" ...
customer_reviews.text: Present to wife. She was initially not that "hot" on wearing it, but now siz months later is wearing it all the time. Although no GPS, the distance tracker is amazingly accurate, and we have tested it while walking the dogs on "known" routes several times. FitBit in our case logs the distance correctly down to about a 1/10th of a mile, which has to be deemed very accurate. I would buy one myself, but the evolution on "wearables" is so quick at the moment, so holding off a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Wellcraft19

customer_reviews.title: Good results, would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Have had my Fitbit for a year and a half and still love it. I specifically chose the One model because I do not like to wear things on my wrists. Good for activity awareness and motivation. Recommend using Friends and Challenges feature for an extra boost and encouragement. I have purchased extra clip holders since the original broke and I no longer use the sleep band because the Velcro is wearing out (can buy a replacement but it is not important to me).
customer_reviews.author: Leslie K

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended to help track your exercise progress and sleep patterns!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Fitbit One! I ordered this right before I had knee replacement surgery and it arrived the day after I got out of the hospital. It really helped me to track my steps and progress throughout my recovery process. I also love the sleep monitor - it really helped me to understand why I was so exhausted even after being in bed for hours and hours. I was able to pinpoint times that I tended to wake up at night and helped me to better gauge what helped me sleep better and what caused restless nights.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L Vance

customer_reviews.title: Works great - and somehow survived trip through washing machine and dryer!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a year - works well with iPhone and a great motivator to walk and to sleep better. Sleep stats are not super-accurate (it says I'm asleep when I'm awake for hours) but they are somewhat usable in the long run. I like the vibrating wrist alarm to wake up in the morning. Quality and reliability seem excellent - the thing is tiny and so lightweight, yet the battery lasts many days. Amazingly, it went through the washing machine AND the dryer and still came out working fine after it cooled down.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the bundle offer, it comes with clip and wrist band already.
customer_reviews.text: I just received my fitbit one yesterday, so no long term review here. This is more of a heads up to those that are looking at the bundle that Amazon has. I obviously didn't read what the fitbit one included, but it includes both the clip and the sleep wrist band so don't buy those in the bundle. I used the sleep function last night. The wrist band is quite comfortable but being my first night, I was aware of wearing it. My sleep info definitely showed this too. It seemed pretty accurate. Now, to see if it will help to keep me motivated to move more. I do like the app and the goal and food tracking too.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie K

customer_reviews.title: Great product, does what I bought it to do
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile before I began to use, but it has delivered exactly what it said. Pros: 1. Accurate total of number of steps: day, week, month ,,, 2. Device is completely unobtrusive 3. Gives me the option to track caloric intake 4. Love the charts / graphs to monitor progress 5. All information is easily synchronized with the computer I use this in conjunction with my Polar Monitor (for while cycling)
customer_reviews.author: RWC-PSI

customer_reviews.title: So great, I bought another
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Fitbit One for over a year. It has been through the wash and still works perfectly. The step counter is very accurate as I've tested it while counting my steps on the treadmill. The clip fastens securely with no fear of losing it. It is easy to see and read the info including steps, calories burned, stairs climbed and miles walked. I love it so much I bought another for my husband's birthday. He wears it daily while making deliveries.
customer_reviews.author: Sentrisity

customer_reviews.title: I am so pleased with this device
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this device. I did not want to have to wear that silly rubber band around my arm. So tacky looking and very much a fad. I love that this just goes right in my pocket with my keys. Hidden from view and very accurate. It certainly helps me to keep my mind on my exercise and how much is enough or not enough. One of the biggest realities was taking it on my walk that I always thought gave me enough exercise for the day. When I realized that it only gave me 3000 steps I was flabbergasted! I recommend this device if you are serious about getting enough daily exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus H.Wall

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit not working after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Oct. 14, 2014 Update on Fitbit One, I found out why the Fitbit was NOT showing miles, stairs or the flower. With an update my preferences were turned off. I went online and researched this to change a goal and found out everything was turned off. So I would highly recommend the Fitbit One At first I really like my Fitbit One, but after seven months the button no longer works. When I push the button it does NOT show miles, floors or anything but the amount of steps I have taken. Disappointing for the amount of money I spent on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: The only issue I have with it is that it records steps when I wear it in my tractor and I get a pretty substantial number of ste
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one as I keep losing them. It does everything I need. I bought my first one because my wife was constantly telling me I didn't exercise enough. I got it to prove to her that I did more than she does. The only issue I have with it is that it records steps when I wear it in my tractor and I get a pretty substantial number of steps from that. I use it to my advantage when I show my wife my weekly average number of steps and have offered to buy her one so we can compare. She hasn't nagged me about exercise in over three years......I love my Fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Flex! Love Fitbit One!
customer_reviews.text: First tried the Fitbit Flex... it lasted about 4 months then died on me. :( Well, I didn't like having to wear the plastic band all the time, not a great fashion statement on days I'm dressing up. I opted to try Fitbit One next. It seamlessly switched to the new device without loosing any historical data online. I love the clip option - just need to be careful not to forget it on clothes! The tracking of stairs climbed is an added bonus over the Flex, and I like being able to read the status on the device. All and all, this one is a keeper!!
customer_reviews.author: Hopeful One

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: It gives you the info you need but a little annoying as far as keeping it on you, I tend to knock it off. I also missed the positive feedback/vibration when I hit my daily goal. Switching to sleep band is also annoying. I had the HR which I loved but lost. I wanted to try this one because I wasn't wearing my other timepieces. I may have to try the Alta, which may be a happy median for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got me going!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It helps me keep track of my activity ( or lack of!) and increase walking, moving, burning calories in general and encouraging me by making me aware of increasing activity. I know 'something" is holding me accountable.....and I cannot hide my bad lazy habits! I have not figured out about the sleep program, I wore it one night but did not see anything on my fitbit the next morning. Since it did not come with an instruction book, that I'm used to, but had to check it out on line. Easily clips on my strap and is not visible.
customer_reviews.author: school nurse

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit lover! 💞
customer_reviews.text: I am a Fitbit charge user for almost 2 years. But right now, I am a student of medical assistant and my accessories are limited. I wanted something that will track my activities even it is not in my wrist. (Because I tried to put the fitbit charge on my pocket and it's not accurate) and I gladly found this cute thing! I love the color and I can just clip it on my bra, and I am good to go! It includes the charger connector, USB dongle, clip, and the wrist band to use during bedtime. I love it! 💞
customer_reviews.author: Rie Del Rosario

customer_reviews.title: I had the one that's a watch, however, ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the one that's a watch, however, I prefer to wear my own designer watches and it was hot on my wrist. This clip on is a no brainer. I can still track my steps, encourage my self without something cumbersome on my wrist. Clip it to top of pants, pants pocket, and ladies even your bra. Very functional.
customer_reviews.author: T. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love the Fitbit One!
customer_reviews.text: I received the Fitbit One for Christmas 2015 and have had it now for nearly 9 months. It has worked so well and I love all it's features! The clasp has worked well and stayed put on my jeans pocket or bra. I highly recommend this for those who want to count calories, steps, distance walked/run and stairs climbed. And for those who don't want to wear a wrist band. I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: The Key to Weight Loss Success
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this little thing, and I love it. I clip it to my bra strap, and go! No one knows I have it on. It counts your steps, flights of stairs, vigorous activity, calories burned, how you sleep - it's amazing. You can check it to see how you are doing towards goal whenever you want, on the device or on an app on your phone. Then, you also get a weekly report! How cool is that! I have lost a bunch of weight since I have had this. I don't know who wouldn't benefit from this little friend!
customer_reviews.author: Moselle

customer_reviews.title: Edited...I love my fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I am editing my review. While the product pretty much does it's job well, I find they die quickly. I should not be buying a new one every 6-12 months! Come on Fitbit - make these things last...or you are going to lose me as a customer... Previous review: I love my fitbit. tells me when I'm having a sedentary day. tells me when I am having an outstanding active day. My wife now has one as do two of my children - keeps them from sitting in front of screens because it tells them without me having to say so....Bob
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Happiness
customer_reviews.text: Love how it tracks every movement I make. It has helped me to be more active and try to meet my daily goals. Sharing with others your challenges and competing with others is motivating and helpful. Love the small size so it's not obvious your wearing a tracker and especially love that the battery last so long I'm not having to charge it all the time. Only drawback is clip on case is a little stiff so I worry it will break if I try to clip it on thicker fabric. Wish it would automatically know when I fall asleep and wake up as sometimes I forget to set sleep timer on or off. Very happy I bought the Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: YVONNE TACKOOR

customer_reviews.title: Washer and Dryer Proof
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Fitbit one for four months now. It's great. I have set it to only display the time, steps, and calories burned. I don't like flipping between too many screens. I don't use the sleep feature either but I do use the app to log my weight and calories almost daily. It's convenient to receive an email when the battery is low and plug it into it's USB charger while I sleep. Today, I forgot to remove it from my clothes before putting them in the hamper. My partner washed and dried my Fitbit One and to our surprise, it's still working!!! It did count 7,000 steps in the process. I'm very impressed with this little device.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Puts weight and fitness control in your hands (or pocket)
customer_reviews.text: I'm sold on Fitbits! I like this clip-on version, because I don't like wearing watches etc on my wrist. I really like knowing how far I've walked, and seeing the balance between calories in and calories burned. The Fitbit makes it very easy to maintain a calorie deficit, and slowly (or quickly) lose weight -- or maintain weight, once you've reached your goal.
customer_reviews.author: Redpoll

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have had my One for nearly 3 years now. I love it. My husband recently got a Charge HR from his company and didn't want it so I put it on my account, but I honestly think I still just prefer my One. If you get this, make sure to get a Fitbit Finder app. You can get one for free. I have had to use mine many times because I have forgotten where I sat my One down. Once it came off my pants and fell into my chest freezer without me knowing. The finder found it though!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tracker - easy and quite flexible in wear!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Fitbit One for over 5 years now and really love it. The activity that is logs is great -- stairs are also included so that the flights of stairs are logged. The battery is very long lasting and I normally only need a recharge once a week or less often. I also have a Flex 2 (to record swimming strokes), but I like the Fitbit One best. The syncing is great -- either to my Surface Pro tablet or to my Smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Couch

customer_reviews.title: Good not great and easy to lose
customer_reviews.text: The readouts on the device and the dashboard are cool but really any pedometer and/or fitness app (MyFitnessPal, Pedometer, MapMyRun etc) can do the same for free. And the One, though the clip is strong, it's just too easy to leave it in a pocket somewhere. And though it's small size and light weight are a benefit, they also make it really easy to lose it and if it falls off you'd never know it. I'm getting a Flex instead. Though the reading may be a bit overestimated, I'm much more comfortable with a wristband. In this hot weather I'm changing my clothes often and don't want to have to deal with switching it to another piece of clothing.
customer_reviews.author: HailtoTheVictors

customer_reviews.title: Love my Fitbit One!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fitbit One. Prior to purchasing a Fitbit I had a different brand of activity monitor (WeightWatchers Active Link) which fell off my waistband several times. The last time it fell off in a parking lot and was crushed before I noticed it missing. So I was a little hesitant to get another "clip-on" however this has a longer and much stronger clip. it has never come off regardless of the activity. I find it to be very accurate, easy to read, an I love the Smart phone inter-active software. It sends me a weekly activity recap, and challenges me to do more. I also like that it records flights of stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Susan has Opinion

customer_reviews.title: It's the greatest
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Fitbit One for about two months now and I love it. I tend to be sedentary, and this really encourages me to move around. It tracks everything, including sleep. You can wear it anywhere - pocket, belt, pants waist, tucked in the bra. Small and unobtrusive. Both the device and the website are among the best designed technical toys I have every seen. The website is very rich. It lets you log in a lot of things manually if you wish. It also has communities where you can interact with other users. Their scale, which I just bought, is also great.
customer_reviews.author: dpk

customer_reviews.title: Love this fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my fitbit one. I didn't want a wrist step counter. I like to dress up and I felt like that would throw off my look. I wear this in the middle of my bra, on the inside. Only bad part is that I have almost washed it before. Now I remember to take it off every time instead of leaving it attached to my bra. I'd say the only real improvements I'd like it to have would be cuter clips, being waterproof, and having a longer battery life but I'm not complaining. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Kourtney loves Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Windows XP users: it will work with XP once it's set up, but I don't think you can set it up with XP =/
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on using Fitbit exclusively on a PC using Win XP, set up is a nightmare and may be impossible (at least as of fall 2014). I read one helpful article that had some techie talk that boiled down to Explorer 8 or greater is needed in the Windows environment to set up the devise. Here's the rub: Explorer 8 is not compatible with Win XP! So, you will need to set up the Fitbit on a PC running a newer version of Windows, or some other compatible devise. I set mine up on a friend's machine running Win 7. BUT, once the Fitbit is set up, it does run just fine with Win XP.
customer_reviews.author: a Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little product ... but it can be somewhat addicting. We've also had a couple brushes with moisture - one of which resulted in a complete failure. Still, we find that slipping these into our pockets is the most ideal as a) it's innocuous and b) we don't find the wristbands to be the sort of style statement that we're going for. Accuracy is decent as far as the steps are concerned. Distance is seriously questionable though, and we have no way of ascertaining if the "floors" is meaningful. In counting steps though it's pretty much spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce P Osler

customer_reviews.title: Great activity tracker!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love these Fitbit Ones! They really give you some insight into how active, or not active, you are during the day. Both of us have desk jobs and it was honestly scary how little activity we used to have during the day. For the last month or so since we got these we've been working hard to meet our daily goals. These have honestly motivated to be more active and healthy. My Mother saw ours and liked it and now she has one too.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Item will not work
customer_reviews.text: The fitbit will not power up even though the battery is fully charged. We sought help from fitbit he;p center and the item is being replaced under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Hinshaw

customer_reviews.title: The fitbit one is a fantastic tracker that is small
customer_reviews.text: The fitbit one is a fantastic tracker that is small, convenient, and does everything that I wanted for a great price. This device was a very nice help with learning the overall scope of my physical activity during the workweek
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Feedback from a geezer
customer_reviews.text: I read many of the reviews and realized I had to be careful not to loose it. Despite my vigilance I managed to lose it anyway. The couple of weeks I did have it I realized that its something fun for younger people who like to graph and chart everything but this older person doesn't need all the bells and whistles. I just want to know how many steps I've taken during each day and I don't need a chart or graph to tell me. Must admit that I got a great laugh on the way home from work one day when my Fitbit said I'd done 6 flights of stairs driving home in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Best. Investment
customer_reviews.text: Best. Investment. Ever. I love this little device. It is very accurate on step counting (more accurate, in my opinion, than some of it's wrist band counterparts). It motivated me to keep moving by allowing me to set goals. I am huge on achieving goals I set, so I am not happy until all of my goal categories "turn green" for the day. It syncs up nicely with my fitness pal for calorie tracking. I have used this combined with my fitness pal for a couple of years now. I find it keeps my diet and exercise on track. It accountability in the form of a 2 inch device.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: but I love the small size and ability to clip on my ...
customer_reviews.text: My first device of this kind. Read reviews about the different models of Fitbit (Flex, Charge, etc.), but I love the small size and ability to clip on my pants or bra. The battery life is amazing (2+ weeks) and only has an hour charging time. I charge mine while I get ready in the morning. The free that you download to view all of the information is very helpful. You can track you steps, sleep, food intake, water consumption, exercise, etc. I recommend this for a beginner to moderate user.
customer_reviews.author: Liz from SA

customer_reviews.title: Very Short Useful Life
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about six months, then stopped recording and kept randomly changing times. Very weird. Reloaded software and rebooted several times, but no change in these issues. Unit was not subjected to anything other than fast walking on a treadmill. Very disappointed in the quality. I guess they just want you to keep buying the "latest" version.
customer_reviews.author: Watts

customer_reviews.title: It didn't last nearly as long as it should have.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Fitbit One in July 2014 and a mere 7 months later it has stopped working. Numerous times over the last few weeks it goes dead even though the battery has been fully charged. I have to reset it whenever I realize it has happened and find out that I have large periods of lost data as a result. What started out being a motivating, information-filled experience has left me very frustrated. This is the second Fitbit I have purchased; the last one was the old model and it broke as well. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jmtbadger

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, easy, long-lived, and quick charging: winner!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for over a year now, and I love it! Worn on my bra strap, it seems to be more accurate than some of the wrist-worn units my friends have. I don't find it bothersome to switch it to its stretchy wristband for sleep monitoring, either; it's become a familiar part of my routine. It typically needs to be charged just once per week, and doing that while I'm sitting watching TV at the end of the day means I don't miss capturing any steps while it's charging.
customer_reviews.author: Bardicvoice

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: This little device is the key to the motivation highway. It connects you, and your measurable activity, to a well-designed, personalized, fitness feedback system. It's always in your pocket (or wherever you might put it) so it is always there to let you know how your executing on your daily goals - steps walked, floors climb, calories burned, miles walked. The result... you're likely to hit them. We have been. We're more aware of our activity levels and calories consumption, and we're doing something about both. Fundamentally, it's just about burning more calories than you consume. No special diet for us, just awareness and a increased discipline - all thanks to the FitBit and the companion website. Brilliant, really.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C. Moore

product_meta.title: Fitbit One Wireless Activity Plus Sleep Tracker, Burgundy
product_meta.description:
Color:BurgundyFitness means being active, sleeping well, and eating smarter – and the Fitbit One helps you do all three. During the day, it tracks your steps, distance, calories burned, and stairs climbed. Come nightfall, it measures your sleep cycle to help you see how to sleep better; and it can even wake you in the morning without waking your partner. Your stats upload wirelessly via computer or select mobile devices (like the iPhone 4S). Powered by your stats, you can set goals, and track progress. Stay motivated by earning badges or connecting with friends for support or friendly competitions. Log food, work-outs and more. Bring greater fitness into your life – seamlessly, socially, 24 hours a day.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Keep it Clean: Regularly clean your band and wrist—especially after working out or sweating. Rinse the band with water or wipe it with a small amount of rubbing alcohol. Do NOT use hand soap, body soap, dish soap, hand sanitizers, cleaning wipes or household cleaners which could get trapped beneath the band and irritate skin. Always dry the band well before putting it back on. Keep it Dry: While Fitbit devices are water resistant*, it’s not good for your skin to wear a wet band for long periods of time. If your elastomer band gets wet—like after sweating or showering—rinse and dry it thoroughly before putting it back on your wrist. Be sure your skin is dry before you put your band back on. Don’t Wear It Too Tight: Make sure your band isn’t too tight. Wear the band loosely enough that it can move back and forth on your wrist. If you use Fitbit products with Purepulse Heart Rate tracking, for better heart rate readings during exercise, we suggest wearing the band so it’s secure, but not too tight, and wearing the band higher on your wrist (about 2-3 finger widths above your wrist bone). Lower the band on your wrist and loosen it after exercise. Give Your Wrist a Rest: Prolonged rubbing and pressure may irritate the skin, so give your wrist a break by removing the band for an hour after extended wear.

BUYING GUIDE
Move it up: Since blood increases further up your arm, wear your tracker higher on your wrist to improve the heart rate signal during workouts. Start by moving the device up to three finger widths above your wrist bone, then experiment with slightly lower placement. Keep it secure: The less your tracker moves during exercise, the more chance you have of maintaining a heart rate signal throughout the activity. Do not wear the band too tightly, as this can restrict blood flow and goes against our wear and care guidelines. Hold steady for ten seconds: High intensity exercises or activities that cause you to keep your wrist bent (like push-ups) or move your arms vigorously (like dance) may interfere with heart rate signals. If you stop seeing a signal during these types of activities, hold your wrist steady for ten seconds during breaks to get your reading.

See more
feature_bullets: One syncs automatically and wirelessly to tablets, computers and 150+ leading iOS, Android and Windows smartphones using Bluetooth 4.0 wireless technology. Syncing to computers requires Internet connection and USB port. Syncing to mobile devices requires Bluetooth and Internet connection. Syncing range: 20 feet. Call notifications via Bluetooth 4.0

Water Resistance: Charge has been tested up to 1 ATM meaning it is sweat, rain and splash proof. However, the device is not swim proof. We also recommend taking Charge off before showering because, as with any wearable device, it’s best for your skin if the band stays dry and clean.
Warning: Do not use if you have a pacemaker or other internal, or implanted medical device. Not intended for use by children under 13. Always consult your physician. Slippery when wet
We recommend charging your device every few days to ensure you are always tracking. Charge time: One to two hours. Battery life: up to 7 - 10 days. Battery type: Lithium-polymer
